from collections.abc import Mapping
from itertools import chain
from operator import add
#ignore FutureWarning messages 
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", message="iteritems is deprecated")
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from pprint import pprint as pp
import json

from notebookutils import mssparkutils
### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API
jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/zendesk_items") 
mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
'abfss://odw-raw@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/ZenDesk/Export/', 
"/zendesk_items", 
{"linkedService":"ls_storage"}

def write_to_single_file():

    with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/zendesk_items/export-2023-03-15-1051-10932060-13758561992081e5c3.json", 'r',encoding="utf-8") as zendesk_json_raw:

        zendesk_json_decoded = zendesk_json_raw.read()

        zendesk_json_array = zendesk_json_decoded.split("\n")

        item_number = 0

        for zendesk_json_item in zendesk_json_array:

            if zendesk_json_item != "":

                zendesk_json_dict = json.loads(zendesk_json_item)

                with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/zendesk_items/output_{item_number}.json", "w", encoding="utf-8") as write_single_zendesk_json:

                    json.dump(zendesk_json_dict, write_single_zendesk_json)

                item_number += 1

write_to_single_file()

from pyspark.sql import SparkSession 
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate() 
shows = spark.read.json("abfss://odw-raw@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/ZenDesk/Export/output_*.json",multiLine=True)
shows.printSchema()
